entry.title: Woman charged with murder denied pretrial release
entry.summary: Sierra Sioux Jennings, 29, was denied pretrial release and will remain at the Douglas County Jail for her alleged involvement in the murder of 34-year-old Joshua Lynn Alexander.

entry.title: From 'tin building' to destination resort
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — Take a look at the popular Seven Feathers complex here — the glitzy casino, luxury hotel, spacious convention center, truck stop and RV park — and it’s easy to overlook how long, difficult and groundbreaking the journey was…

entry.summary: The next Friends of the Umpqua Hiking Club hike is scheduled for Oct. 28.

entry.title: Merging Oakland's past and present

entry.title: Tickets available for UCC legacy ball
entry.summary: It’s the 50th anniversary for the Umpqua Community College Foundation and tickets are now on sale for the seventh annual Legacy Ball.

entry.title: Oregon State University grants $500K to protect dunes
entry.summary: Oregon State University secured a $500,000 federal grant to assess and impact dune environments from sea level rise in the Pacific Northwest.

entry.title: Tis the season for visiting the pumpkin patch
entry.summary: October is one of my favorite times of the year. I enjoy the cool, foggy mornings as I’m driving out to site visits.

entry.title: Emily Ring hired as new Douglas County Emergency Manager
entry.summary: Douglas County officials announced Friday that Emily Ring has taken over as the Douglas County Emergency Manager.

entry.title: Roseburg Library encourages reading graphic novels
entry.summary: Graphic novels are a big hit at Roseburg Public Library, and we love to see people of all ages engaging with this dynamic format.

entry.title: Roseburg Rite Aid remains open
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Roseburg Rite Aid store on Northwest Garden Valley Boulevard is remaining open, with only one Rite Aid location in Oregon slated for closure, following the company’s filing for bankruptcy protection Sunday.

entry.title: Nonfarm payroll employment rises by 8,100 jobs in September
entry.summary: In September, Oregon’s seasonally adjusted nonfarm payroll employment rose by 8,100 jobs, following a revised decline of 700 jobs in August.

entry.summary: Roseburg Sister Cities will host an Annual Pot Luck Dinner and Meeting at 4-7 p.m., Nov. 5 at Saint Paul’s Church’s Social Hall, 750 W. Keady Court, Roseburg. Members and prospective members are welcome.
